message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with the task of referring expression comprehension, which involves localizing an object instance in an image based on a natural language description. This task is at the intersection of computer vision and natural language processing, making cs.CV and cs.CL the most likely categories. The paper proposes a graph-based attention mechanism that captures inter-object relationships and properties, which is a technique commonly used in machine learning and artificial intelligence, making cs.AI a likely category as well. The proposed approach also involves visualizing and explaining the comprehension decision, which falls under the category of interpretability and explainability, making cs.LG a possible category. Finally, the paper involves experiments on three referring expression comprehension datasets, which is a common practice in information retrieval and machine learning, making cs.IR a possible category.
